{"step_by_step_thinking": "The anal canal is divided into two parts by the pectinate line. Above the pectinate line, the anal canal is supplied by the superior rectal artery as stated in Document [1], [2], [14], [19], and [21]. Below the pectinate line, the anal canal is supplied by the middle and inferior rectal arteries as stated in Document [8], [9], [14], [19], and [21]. Therefore, all three arteries mentioned in the options supply the anal canal.", "answer_choice": "D. all of the following"}
